result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheila A. Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sheila A. Davis in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Sheila A. Davis in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CM178, 14CM181, 15CM90,15CF78, 16CM60,14CM170 and 16CF51 @ 1:40 p.m. Agreement stated - 14CM170, 14CM178 State moves to dismiss and read in. 14CM181 Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, probation 3 yrs, court costs, AODA and follow through, counseling as deemed necessary, 8 days credit if revoked. 15CF78 amended information filed, Def will plead to charge, withheld sent, 3 yrs probation with same conditions, 60 days jail commence immediately, 86 days credit if revoked, bond to be applied to costs, with any remainder applied to other cases beginning with oldest. 14CM181 - State will withdraw request to forfeit bond, and apply to costs. 15CM90 - dismissed and read in. 16CM60 - State has compled with VWNR also for 15CF78. 16CM60 Def will plead to ct 1, State would move to dismiss ct 2 and dom ab enhancer on ct 1; 3 yrs probation, same conditions, no jail, 7 days credit if revoked. 16CF51, plead to ct 2, ct 1 dismiss and read in, withheld sent 3 yrs probation, same conditions, no jail, no credit if revoked. Atty Debord agrees. Def understands and agrees. State grants motion to dismiss ct 1 of 16CF51. 15CF78 Court grants motion to amend ct 1. State advises that an additional conditions of probation are no use of alcohol and no presence in taverns. Atty Debord agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CM60 ct 1 - no contest. 14CM181 ct 1 - no contest. 15CF78 ct 1 as amended - no contest. 16CF51 ct 2 - no contest. Court grants motions to dismiss and read in 14CM178, 15CM90, 16CM60 ct 2, 14CM181 ct 2, 14CM170, 15CF78 cts 2 & 3. 16CF51 ct 1 - dismissed out right. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Debord satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 16CM60 ct 1 disorderly conduct as repeater (dom ab enhancer is dismissed), 14CM181 ct 1 misd bail jumping, 15CF78 ct 1 as amended - interfere w/child custody as repeater, 16CF51 ct 2 misd bail jumping. Counsel heard on sentencing. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. 16CM60 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 3 yrs probation, credit for 7 days if revoked, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, AODA and follow through, counseling as deemed appropriate, no use of alcohol, no presence in taverns. $200 bond applied to costs. 14CM181 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 3 yrs probation, court costs, (no DNA) same conditions, credit for 8 days if revoked. Apply bond. 15CF78 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 3 yrs probation, same conditions as two prior, credit for 86 days if revoked. Additional condition - 60 days jail, commence today, huber as allowed by jail, apply bond  - DNA surcharge on this case. Apply any remaining bond to oldest cases. 16CF51 ct 2 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, same conditions, no credit if revoked, DNA surcharge. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Any bonds in dismissed cases apply to costs beginning with oldest cases first.

ADDRESS INFO for Sheila A. Davis
Current: 810 Arctic St, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2016)
Prior: 514 Lincoln Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Sheila A. Davis in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF78, 14CM178, 14CM181 15CM90 & 14CM170,  @ 8:35 AM.  Sgt Jerry Reichl, City of Antigo Police Department, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State moves for bind over.  Atty Debord objects bind over.  State gives statement.  Court finds grounds felonies have been committed & binds overs. Information Filed.  Atty Debord has copy of information, waives reading & enter Not Guilty plea to all 3 ct's. Court receives Not Guilty plea on all 3 ct's. Status Cnf to be set on all cases.  14CM178 Bail/Bond Forfeiture be stayed. Court will delay ruling on bond forfeiture.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court calls 14CM170, 14CM178, 14CM181, 15CM90, and 15CF78 @ 10:12. Defendant Sheila A. Davis not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduled for 10:00 a.m. Atty Hersil has filed request to withdraw and has informed the Court that he has not been able to contact Def in several weeks. State asks for warrant, body only, however, not sure if Def was present at last status conf. Off the record briefly. Back on the record - Court does not know if Def aware of today's hearing. Off the record again briefly. State now asks for new status conf. with Def getting notice that appearance is mandatory. Court grants Atty Hersil's motion to withdraw. Atty preparing order. COC to send notice of mandatory appearance at status conf.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Sheila A. Davis in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Andrew Polzin appears by telephone. Court calls 15CF78, 14CM170,14CM178, 14CM181, and 15CM90 @ 2:32 p.m. Atty Polzin advised the Court prior to going on the record that he is not appointed on 15CF78 which was scheduled for prelim hrg today. Court will adjourn all cases for status conference. Atty Polzin or whoever will be representing from his office may appear by telephone, Def should appear in person. If Atty Hersil will be taking cases, may reschedule if needed.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Sheila A. Davis in court via video with attorney Andrew R Polzin.  Defendant Sheila A. Davis in custody.  Ralph Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, reviewed.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court accepts plea.  Bond recommendations by State.   Bond set by court  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
